Fields.DialogueText: No matter the season, it's always windy out here when we're cruising at thirty knots.
And once again, Shropshire is running late.
Reporting as ordered, Captain.
But not at the ordered time.
Ah! Such a lovely breeze we get to enjoy out here on the bridge wing, isn't it?
Yes, it really—
Shropshire!
Come on. Don't stop calling me "Salop" just because you're annoyed.

Fields.MenuText: Okay. "Salop" it is.
Fine, but don't change the subject like that.
"Salop" is such a strange name. Sounds like "sloppy."

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Captain.
Just a helpful reminder.
No, it does not!
What did you want to talk to me about?
First, we need to talk about your tardiness.
Aim those binoculars off the starboard beam. I think you'll find I'm right on time.
... Point taken. Get us to battle stations!
Aye-aye, Captain.
@BATTLE
Quit checking your watch and take this - my after-action report.
And it's on time.
Hmm... Not a bad bit of shooting, Salop.
This ship has seen a lot of action, and that means plenty of practice. More than most of my sisters.

Fields.MenuText: I'm still new at this myself.
I have a few fights under my own belt.
I've seen a lot of action, too.

Fields.DialogueText: No need for modesty, Captain! You've got great instincts.
I should say so. You handle combat quite capably.
That's easy to see. It inspires confidence among the crew.
Thanks. You have a lot of faith in me.
One thing the report doesn't really do justice to - in our last fight, some of those hits we landed on the Morganas seemed...
Lucky?
Right.
Get used to that. I've always had more than my share of luck.
*ALARM*
More Morganas. Guess we can't be lucky all the time.
Let's make some luck of our own!
@BATTLE
Well, the kittens like you.
Heh.
Did I forget to wind my watch?
*TICKING*
Nope, it's keeping good time... Unlike Shropshire.
Hullo, Cap!
Salop! Lose track of time again?
No, not at all. Just helping the crew with some work on the capstan.

Fields.MenuText: I needed you here for the operations brief.
Quite helpful of you, but I'd rather have you here on time.
I'd assumed you were pinned down by the cats again.

Fields.DialogueText: Please forgive my tardiness, but they needed my help.
Of course, Captain.
Not this time. I have witnesses!
That capstan maintenance would have taken them all day without some help.
The crew has their duties, but I need to make sure you focus on your own as this ship's Belle.
I assure you, Captain, I am always mindful of my duties. In fact, I—
*ALARM*
This has to wait. Morganas!
@BATTLE
Heh.
Thanks again, ma'am. Everybody on the No. 2 gun appreciated your help.
Don't mention it, love. This Belle was happy to put her muscles to good use.
Attention on deck!
Carry on, sailor.
Aye-aye, Captain.
Maintenance is complete on all guns, Captain. Anything else that needs doing?
As a matter of fact, yes.

Fields.MenuText: Take a break. We all need our rest.
The food in the galley could be better.
Anything but another musical.

Fields.DialogueText: I never sit still for long, Captain!
Ha! I'm a girl from the English countryside, not a French chef.
Listen, I think that cast reading went very well.
I'll come up with something.
@BATTLE
Shropshire!
That's not the impression I got from Ica.
Well, maybe if I convince her to sing herself she'll be more--
Take a walk with me on the weather decks, Salop.
Gladly, Captain.
Fair weather we're having.
Yes, lovely, but please tell me we have a new assignment or something to do.
I'm expecting patrol orders before long - but for now just walk with me.
Of course. I—
Hey! Sailor!
Captain. Ma'am.
At ease.
Not so fast, sailor. Chin up and back straight! We've got a war to win.
Yes... Yes, ma'am!
That's better. Stand tall!

Fields.MenuText: No room for slouching aboard, eh?
Try not to contradict me in front of the crew, please.
This isn't a finishing school. We're a warship.

Fields.DialogueText: Not if I can help it.
You're right, Captain, but I couldn't ignore what I saw.
It still matters.
I pay close attention to the crew's morale. Strong posture shows a strong will.
I doubt there's a Belle with better posture than you, Salop.
@BATTLE
*ALARM *
I also can't ignore that we have company.
Still no orders from Command. At least I'm getting some reading done in my cabin.
*KNOCK*
Do you have a minute?
The door's unlocked, Salop.
*sigh*

Fields.MenuText: That's a face I have never seen you make before.
What's troubling you?
Are you hiding from someone?

Fields.DialogueText: Is it that obvious?
It's about the crew.
If I can't solve this problem, I might have to.
We still don't have orders from Command, and I'm running out of new and interesting ways to keep the crew occupied.
I guess you can only have so many wheelbarrow races and belching contests before people get bored.
Exactly! I need help coming up with ways to keep the crew motivated.
*ALARM*
How about blasting Morganas?
Not quite what I had in mind, but it'll have to do!
@BATTLE
Anything from Command, sailor?
No priority messages yet, Captain.
Captain, I got it!

Fields.MenuText: Keep it down in the radio room, Salop.
Did you get our new orders?
That sounds wonderful...but what the heck are you talking about?

Fields.DialogueText: Pardon the outburst. I'm just excited!
No, but I have something almost as good.
Let me catch my breath and I will tell you.
I've got the best idea for a crew activity! It's going to be such fun!
Well? Spit it out!
That would ruin the surprise!
I'm not sure I like the sound of this.
*ALARM*
Or the sound of that.
Time to get to work!
@BATTLE
Everyone to your stations!
@BATTLE
Attention, all hands! Attention! This is your Belle speaking!
Why is she using the loudspeaker? I need to get to the bridge and sort this out.
Stand by for the signal to commence!
Ahem.
Oh! Hiya, Cap.

Fields.MenuText: What's going on here, Salop?
Is this the "crew activity" you were talking about before?
Are we under attack?

Fields.DialogueText: We're just about to get started.
It is!
Nothing of the sort!
I've got something special arranged to keep the crew entertained.
You never told me what it was, you know.
I thought you might enjoy a surprise. Captains need to have fun, too.
And they need to know what their Belle is up to.
Don't fret about a thing. I promise it won't make too much mischief.
That's hardly reassuring, Shropshire.
Salop.
Right.
*WHISTLE*
Let the games begin!
Everyone to your stations!
@BATTLE
Shropshire's playing some kind of game with the crew, but wouldn't tell me what it's all about.
Plus, I can't find any of the crew to ask what's going on. This cruiser's become a ghost ship.
Another empty space. Looks deserted here in this ammunition storage compartment.
Maybe I can find one of the chiefs in berthing.
Empty in here too. Where is everybody?!
*giggle*
I heard that! Come out where I can see you!
Damn! You found me. Does this mean I'm out?

Fields.MenuText: On a warship, we don't sleep under the bunk.
Why aren't you at your post?
Out of your mind, maybe!

Fields.DialogueText: I wasn't sleeping, Captain. Honest!
Shropshire said she would cover our stations during the game.
Ha! It was Miss Shropshire's idea.
Miss Shropshire organized a ship-wide game of hide and seek, and if you... You didn't know, Captain?
Shropshire apparently thought it would be more fun if I didn't know.
I'll be heading back to my post now, Captain.
Even though you caught me and I'm out, it was still fun.
All right. Carry on, sailor.
One down. A thousand to go? I'll need some help. Hey, sailor, come back!
Captain?
If you aren't hiding anymore, help me look for the rest of the crew.
Aye aye!
Have a seat, Salop. I've been looking forward to this.
Appreciate the invite, Cap! It'll be splendid to share a cup of tea with you.
We need to talk.
Oh. That sounds quite serious. Maybe our tea won't be so splendid?
It's about that game of hide and seek that you organized for the crew.
Ah, that. Are you upset with me?

Fields.MenuText: No, but I wish you had told me before doing it.
It was an insane stunt! What if the Morganas attacked while everybody was hiding?!
Not at all! I thought it was a brilliant idea, actually.

Fields.DialogueText: I was just trying to make it more fun for you, Captain.
The crew all had instructions to quit playing if I sounded the alarm, Captain.
Really? I'm thrilled you enjoyed it!
The crew says they loved it. It cured their boredom and got everybody together.
You've always got the crew's interests at heart, Salop. But next time...
Let me know before you organize something like that, all right?
So, we can have a next time?
Well...
*ALARM*
So much for a quiet cup of tea. Finish up and meet me on the bridge!
Already on my way, Salop!
@BATTLE
Coming through! Excuse me! Coming through!
What's the rush?
Oh, it's you! The radio room wanted me to tell you that we have a priority message from Command, Captain.
Understood. I'm taking my coffee to the bridge. Call me as soon as they have the message decrypted.
Aye-aye, Captain. Excuse me, Miss Shropshire.
I overheard. New orders for us, Captain?
That's my guess, but we'll know for sure in a few minutes.
Well, it's about bloody time.

Fields.MenuText: Don't get your hopes up. It's probably just a routine patrol assignment.
It could be anything.
You seem far too eager for combat.

Fields.DialogueText: An encrypted priority message? I doubt that, Captain.
Anything suits me.
I'm never eager for bloodshed, but I'm eager to serve where I'm needed.
In war, a cruiser's proper place is anywhere that can make a difference.
Wait with me on the bridge, and we'll have our answer soon enough.
*ALARM*
First things first! Let's put these Morganas down quickly.
I'm right behind you, Salop.
@BATTLE
Spread out the charts, Salop. I want a good look at what we're doing.
Happy to help. There! That's all sorted. Now we can see the mission area clearly.
Pass me the pencil.
Thanks, Salop. According to the message, the Morganas are likely gathering for a series of raids here...
Here...
And here.
A handful of coastal villages and small port towns.
And our job is to minimize the damage at those locations.
Raids? That's all? It doesn't add up.
I don't understand your point.
Even for a Morgana plan, it's hardly an imaginative one. Why so much secrecy from Command over a few raids?

Fields.MenuText: I'm sure the higher-ups have their reasons.
Maybe those targets are more important than we think.
HQ is protecting the source of this information.

Fields.DialogueText: No doubt about that! But I'd like to know what their reasons are.
Each life in those towns matters, but strategic importance to the Morganas? I don't see it.
We have a spy in the Morgana fleet?!
The classification markings on the message said the intelligence comes from a sensitive source that they don't want to reveal.
Using this intel to disrupt a raid would make them suspicious, though.
*ALARM*
All of these chance encounters with Morganas are making me just as suspicious.
That mystery will have to wait. Battle stations!
@BATTLE
I didn't say that.
Everyone to your stations!
@BATTLE
Pick up that coffee cup. I need room to set these charts down in front of you, Captain.
Done. Show me your plan to get to the mission area.
I worked with our navigator to plot a course to Sydney.
Damn. We're still that far away from the mission area? According to HQ's intel, those raids are coming soon.
We'll make it in time.
Even our high cruising speed was still too slow. Morgana interruptions didn't help either.
We'll make it.
Even if we race the rest of the way at our top speed, that's...
That's exactly what I intend to do, Captain. We have to.
The strain would...
Trust me.

Fields.MenuText: There must be another way.
That would tear our engines apart. I can't authorize that.
I do trust you.

Fields.DialogueText: Look at these charts. The calculations don't lie.
Don't doubt my strength.
Thanks, Cap.
It won't be easy, but I can get us there.
So... we're going to sprint a marathon?
This English Rose won't wilt.
It's always so hot here in the engine room... but right now it's a damn blast furnace!
Crack that valve and gimme more cooling water on the starboard side! Can't lose vacuum on the condensers, mates!
Talk to me, Chief.
Ah, Skipper! Welcome to the engine room!
Give me a status report, Chief. How's Shropshire holding up?
Incredible, considerin' we've never sustained a push like this for so long. In fact, Shrop's givin' us a bit extra.
A little extra what, Chief?
'Bout a knot and a half on top of our rated speed.
What?! Are you sure that's right?
Been checkin' every gauge for myself. Wouldn't believe either, but I'm watching it happen. She's quite the gal, Skipper.

Fields.MenuText: She's going to rip herself apart like this.
Do everything you can to keep her in one piece, Chief.
I shouldn't be surprised. Our Belle's tough as nails.

Fields.DialogueText: Not if we can help it, Skipper. All of us snipes back here are going to take care of our Belle.
You know we will.
And we'll keep her that way, Skipper.
Miss Shropshire gives us all she's got, and we aim to give it right back.
Keep it up. We're almost there.
Wilco, Skipper.
*ALARM*
That alarm... Did a steam header bust loose again?
No, Chief. That's Morganas.
@BATTLE
Everyone to - phew! - your stations!
@BATTLE
Whew! I'm working up a mighty sweat, Captain!
Keep pushing hard! The whole crew is behind you.
If they have oars, now would be a good time to get them out! Hah!
If the crew could swim behind you and push, they would. Everybody is doing their best to support you.
I certainly...
GASP!
I certainly appreciate it. I can –WHEW – I can feel their encouragement.
Would it be too distracting to ask you a question right now?
I would welcome... welcome a distraction, to be honest. What's on your mind?
HQ identified multiple locations on the east coast of Australia as Morgana raid targets.
Aye. I was thinking of – WHEEZE – thinking of that myself. Which one is going to be the first target when the raids start?
Exactly. We're going to have to guess.

Fields.MenuText: Pick the one furthest to the north? Or maybe south?
Alphabetical order?
Put on a blindfold and throw a dart at the navigation chart?

Fields.DialogueText: HQ never told us which direction the Morganas would be coming from. Hard to use that logic.
Ha! I wouldn't have thought of that.
That would make a fun game for the crew!
I'm just going to sail to the middle of the coast and try to sense them.
I suppose that would cover the most area.
With the long range of my guns, maybe we'll see a little more luck.
I hope you're right.
Not now, Salop.
Well, under different circumstances it could be fun.
Everyone to your stations!
@BATTLE
Salop, you did it!
GASP!
You did it! You got us in theater ahead of the raids. Throttle down the engines and drift for now.
Aye- aye... Captain... Just tryin' to...
WHEEZE!
Tryin' to... catch my breath...

Fields.MenuText: Amazing work, Salop!
Is there anything I can do for you?
Are you all right?

Fields.DialogueText: I had loads of help. The engineering department... took good care of me.
I wouldn't mind a... drink. If anything, that sprint gave me quite a thirst!
I'll be right as rain in a few—gasp—minutes.
Don't worry about this country girl, Captain. I've still got plenty of fight in me.
We're going to need it. Until then, rest up as much as you can.
We'll refuel as soon as we can, but it might be a little while.
Morganas sighted to the west. Look sharp, everyone!
@BATTLE
Salop? Are you back here?
Our girl's behind the starboard turbines, Skipper.
Thanks, Chief. Still hazy back here.
And hot as Hades. We're ventilating the engine room as best we can to get our Belle cooled down.
Thanks. Carry on, Chief.
Aye.
Salop?
Ah! I was on my way forward to see you, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Doing better?
You look beat.
Can't afford any more time. We need to get planning.

Fields.DialogueText: Just making sure nothing was broken back here. I'll be fine, Captain.
I'm far from spent, Captain.
Of course.
To the bridge, then. Time to get ready for that Morgana raid.
Take my arm if you need it.
Thanks, Cap.
Gained multiple radar contacts. Extreme long range, Captain. Bearing zero-four-zero.
Very well.
That would be our Morgana raid, incoming.
Steady as she goes, Helm. Don't let on that we're expecting them.
Aye-aye, Captain.
Remember, Salop, the goal is to pretend we're unaware the Morganas are coming.
Quite a bit of fun, really.
Are you kidding me?
Not a bit, Captain! Think of it like... acting in a play.

Fields.MenuText: Let's think of it like, uh, fighting in a war today, all right?
This isn't the time for silly diversions and make-believe games for the crew.
You just gave me an idea...

Fields.DialogueText: But I am, Captain!
I'm quite serious, Captain. We need to fool them with a bit of theatre.
I'll wager pounds to pence we're thinking alike!
"The play's the thing" to catch a king, or a Morgana, right?
Your Shakespeare's not bad for an English country girl.
I'm every bit a Brit, Cap. I've got a plan. Just play along with me. And hand me that pencil.
Here. Make it quick. We don't have much time to get ready.
@BATTLE
Late again?! I know Shropshire is tired, but we can't waste any more time!
I'm here! I was trying to find a pencil and some paper.
Don't be cross, Captain. It's part of my plan.
Walk me through it.
We can't let the Morgana raids know that we're expecting them. HQ can't risk compromising their source of intel.
Right. So how do we explain the fact that we're here?
We'll use the radio. An open frequency.

Fields.MenuText: To do what, exactly?
The Morganas could intercept that, though. I don't get it.
Because we... want them to eavesdrop on us?

Fields.DialogueText: To overhear our performance, of course.
And we want them to intercept it.
Exactly!
We're putting on a little charade. We'll broadcast messages in the clear to make the Morganas think we're here by coincidence.
Do you have a script?
I didn't have time to write one, so we'll have to improvise.
Then how do we know what to say?
Just follow my lead. Oh, and try to make the Morganas think we're helpless, too.
Maybe we pretend we're here for repairs, seeking a safe port or shipyard.
Great idea! That's a lot better than mine.
Which was?
That we had lost a pet turtle and we came here to ask for help finding it.
Right...
*ALARM*
Damn! It looks like they sent scouts ahead of the raid!
Then we need to silence them, and fast. Battle stations!
@BATTLE
My goodness! What a lovely spot for us to have a port call in Australia!
It's... it certainly... um...
Psst! Use the radio, Captain!
Ah, right!
It certainly IS! A lovely place. I love Australia, especially the east coast.
HQ says this will be a safe haven for us. No enemy contact down here, near...
Near, ummm...

Fields.MenuText: Near that place where your sister lives, in WOLLONGONG.
Near that nice little anchorage in GOFFS HARBOR.
Near that, um... uh... that place with all the kangaroos!

Fields.DialogueText: Yes! Maybe we can get our engines fixed there!
That's right! Lucky for us they can repair our busted engines in less than a month!
Um...sure! We can go sightseeing while we wait for our engines to get fixed!
Until then, we'll just be dead in the water, waiting. Might as well, um...
Might as well get a suntan!
That's... um... that's why we're here! I'll see you on the beach! Over!
Over and out!
Think they bought it?
Here comes the first wave. Let's find out!
@BATTLE
We took those Morganas down in short order, Captain. I don't think they had time to warn the others.
They came in all cocky and overconfident, thinking we'd be a soft target.
Like the towns they were trying to raid. Those people are safe for now.
HQ's message said to expect more waves of them. How are you holding up?
To be honest, I'm a little bit winded. Still haven't... gasp... fully recovered from that sprint down here.

Fields.MenuText: Your plan to put on a play was brilliant. Your quick thinking gave us the advantage.
We were lucky. Nothing more.
There's no way a charade like that will work twice.

Fields.DialogueText: You played along brilliantly, Captain!
Luck is my strong suit, Captain.
Not unless you polish your acting skills!
We got this far, thanks to our improvisation. Let's keep those towns safe!
What choice do we have? Helm, all engines stop. Let's sit dead in the water again.
Aye-aye, Captain.
I can sense another group of Morganas coming. Our next audience is on the way!
Give 'em hell, Salop!
@BATTLE
Engines ahead standard, left full rudder.
Aye-aye, Captain.
*BOOM*
Damn! That one was close! The Morgana guns are giving me a headache!
Get us through that turn. The Morganas are going to tear us apart at this range!
Captain, wait!
What is it now?
We need to come around to the other side. Shift the rudder.
No! Helm, belay that order. That's going to leave us vulnerable, Salop.
*BOOM*
Helm, keep that rudder left full.
Yes, but that maneuver exposes the towns to my broadsides. I don't want to hit them by mistake.

Fields.MenuText: A risk we have to take. Besides, if we go down, the towns are as good as dead.
You're right. We can't hit the towns with friendly fire.
Are you sure?

Fields.DialogueText: I won't hurt those innocent townspeople, Captain. They are counting on us to protect them!
Thank you!
Yes! We must protect them at all costs!
All right. Helm, shift your rudder to right full. Bring us around.
Aye aye, Captain. Rudder is right full.
I'll try to give us a little more speed.
Hang on tight! Let's keep those people safe.
@BATTLE
My sides! It feels like they're shot full of holes. It hurts to—to breathe.
Damage control teams are doing their best. Hang in there, Salop.
You know I will, Captain. This girl has lots more to give.
I don't think we were able to put that last fleet of Morganas down before they sent a warning to the last raid group.
You're right. I can already sense the next group on their way.
I'm proud of you, Salop. You...

Fields.MenuText: ... did a great job beating up that last group of Morganas.
... did a great job keeping the crew safe.
... did a great job keeping those towns protected.

Fields.DialogueText: I do it to keep those innocent towns safe. They need a guardian like us, Captain.
More importantly, I'll never let those towns come to harm while I can still shoot, Captain.
That's the most important thing. That's why HQ needed us here, Captain.
War is a terrible, terrible thing. Those civilians deserve none of that horror.
Keep shooting true, Salop. Let's give these Morganas everything we have!
Keep shooting true? I like that. I could use that in my next play, perhaps.
We'll write it down later, I promise.
*ALARM*
For now, we've got work to do.
Let them come!
@BATTLE
Morgana contacts to the north, Captain!
But we already drove the Morgana battle group off. How did they get around us so fast?
I can't explain it, Captain, but the radar signals are strong.
It's another Morgana raid, Captain. They're moving to strike more towns to the north while the last group was distracting us.
We've got to get there fast if we're going to save those people, but...
But what, Captain? Let's go flank speed to the north. We don't have any time to spare!

Fields.MenuText: Let's go. Engines all ahead flank!
I hope the Chief has enough tape and glue to keep those engines together a little longer!
What better way to cool off the guns than with a nice breeze at 30 knots?

Fields.DialogueText: Aye-aye, Captain.
Chief's already wrapped me up like a debutante in a corset. I won't go to pieces just yet!
A lovely thought, Captain!
OOF! One more sprint.
Let's hope this is the last of them!
@BATTLE
Salop, are you awake in there?
I'll always welcome a visit from you in my quarters, Captain. Come on in.
Is that a tray of tea? Lovely. And—AH! You brought Sarah to see me!
*MEOW*
I missed my kitten! Come here, sweet pet! Oh, what's that paper in your hand, Captain?
HQ sent us another encrypted message. Here, have a look.
Sigh... I can barely keep my eyes open, much less read a message right now.
What's our next mission? Sprint back to London? If we're needed, I am ready to try.
No, nothing like that. They sent congratulations for an extraordinary job... and for keeping the source of their intelligence safe.
We all did our best. We have a fine crew.
I know, and I wanted to say I'm sorry.
Sorry?! For what, Captain?
For becoming frustrated with you. For not understanding you.
Whenever I thought you "losing focus" or "getting carried away" with things I thought were silly, they were actually brilliant.
You were taking excellent care of the crew and completing our mission, and in a way that kept everybody's spirits high.
I appreciate that, Captain, I do.
You should never need to apologize to me. This country girl has never served under a finer command.
Oh?
No matter how daft I seemed, you always listened to me. You trusted me, even when I gave you so little to go on.
Of course I trusted you. You're an incredible friend and that I would always want by my side at sea.
My sentiments are exactly the same! Now pour me some of that tea...
